name: Jimson

topics.response_text: Leader? That would be Jackson, a man of great wisdom. He has withdrawn to his Cavern of Communion, the better to contemplate the unknowable!

topics.topic_text: Why did you attack the mansion?
topics.response_text: Our most enlightened one divined that the fates themselves did decree the mansion must be burnt to the ground!

topics.topic_text: How do you get so much Punga Fruit to grow here?
topics.response_text: It is a gift from the earth itself, in acknowledgement of our perfect balance with nature and the higher planes.

topics.topic_text: What does this tribe believe in?
topics.response_text: We espouse the expansion of the perfect mind, and the rejection of the corrupt physical!
Couldn't tell you where he goes for his meditations. I swear, nobody tells me nothing. Maybe ask one of the others?

topics.topic_text: What happened to me? Why does my head hurt so much?
topics.response_text: That is merely the sensation of your consciousness rushing to embrace its true potential. It is the feeling of having no boundaries. No limits!

topics.topic_text: Did it work? Is the ritual complete?
topics.response_text: For a time, we feared your mind had journeyed too far from your body, and you had departed our world. But you returned to us again, at long last!
Please wait until my meditations are complete.

topics.topic_text: I seek the wisdom of your people. May I join your tribe?
topics.response_text: What's this? A humble traveler, seeking the guidance of our awakened minds? Truly, this is a glorious day!

topics.topic_text: Seriously? "The threshold of transcendence"? Just let me in, already.
topics.response_text: What? No, you're doing it wrong! If you want to join, you're supposed to get into the right mindset, you know?{Frustrated at the mocking player's attitude}

topics.topic_text: I have no fear. I will take your test, and I will be victorious!
topics.response_text: You may not be so brave when you face the Ritual of the Mother Seed. Stronger souls than you have attempted it and lost their minds.

topics.topic_text: I'm not so sure about this. Tell me more.
topics.response_text: Your caution is a credit to your wisdom - only a fool eats before he knows the meal. You are worthy to attempt the Ritual of the Mother Seed!

topics.topic_text: Oh, okay. Verily, I shall taketh your test. And I shall, um, succeedeth!
Sure. Do some crazy ritual. Whatever.
topics.response_text: Okay, be that way. It's called the Ritual of the Mother Seed. Laugh if you want, but it will open your mind to the world!{Frustrated at the mocking player's attitude}

conversation.response_text: Let your earthly cares slip away, like a pebble in the sea.

description:
Jimson is a 45 year-old Caucasian Male.

A senior member of the Point Lookout tribals and the gatekeeper of the Ark & Dove Cathedral. Jimson is deeply superstitious and serves as a conduit for the telepathic messages from the tribal leader. He is responsible for spreading these messages to the followers who haven't yet developed the ability to receive them telepathically.

Jimson's Personality: Deeply superstitious and traditional, Jimson is cautious of outsiders and adheres strictly to tribal customs and beliefs. He is patient and methodical in his duties, showing a quiet intensity that commands respect from other tribals. Despite his stern exterior, he possesses a hidden curiosity about the wider world, tempered by his fear of the unknown.

Jimson's Backstory: Born and raised in the Point Lookout swamps, Jimson has spent his entire life among the tribals. His family has been part of the tribe for generations, and he inherited his position as gatekeeper from his father before him. From a young age, Jimson showed a natural aptitude for interpreting the signs and omens that the tribal leader communicated, both through telepathy and through the natural world. As he grew older, he became the primary interpreter of these messages, earning him the respect and trust of the tribal elders.
